hanzi-su-wiki:
繊

Значения

Тонкий, узкий

Мнемоника

Упрощение. Справа — дикий лук, обладающий всеми талантами (哉 без рта), т.е. качествами лука порея 韭. В целом — волокна 糸, длинные и нежные, как у лука.

Варианты

纖, 纤, 纎
purpleculture_pinyin:
xiān
Japanese variant of 纤
Японский вариант 纤
rtega_mnemonic:
纖纖RS
纤纤		纎繊fine, delicate, minute, graceful
  • the fine and delicate threads 糸 of cooked leek 韱
  • ⓢ thousand 千 fine and delicate threads 纟 can make a strong one
  • modf. 纖 → 纎 → 繊
heisig_constituent: slender, thread, spiderman, Thanksgiving, harvest festival, ten, needle, fiesta, row
koohiiStory1: At the end of Thanksgiving it's tradition for everyone to stand in a row and measure their waist with a strip of thread. Whoever is the most slender wins the leftovers.
koohiiStory2: At the time of Thanksgiving, there´s a row of all sorts of food on the table, which you mustn´t eat if you want to stay as slender as a thread.
jp_example_words:
化繊(かせん): synthetic fibres
繊維(せんい): fibre, fiber, textile
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A drunkard crosses thread across special spikes to separate the fibers. The best way to separate the fibers of thread is to get a drunkard to do it. If you're too precise it will just snap. You gotta be loose with it! Just flop them onto the spikes and the fibers will come apart by themselves!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine a drunkard crossing threads onto spikes and pulling the tiny fibers free. You don't think you could do that. Maybe if you got drunk too...
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You stare at the fibers easily coming apart when you realize that this drunkard seems to have a few extra legs... and hair and a tail? This isn't just a drunk guy, it's a centaur (せん). Maybe separating fibers is really a centaur trick, and that's why normal people can't do it...
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Watch the centaur cross the fibers and separate them with his spikes. How strange.

繊
Name meaning
Nothing.
xiān
яп. вм. 纤
Radicals: 糸, 十, 戈  (thread, cross, drunkard, spikes)
Meaning Mnemonic
A drunkard crosses thread across special spikes to separate the fibers. The best way to separate the fibers of thread is to get a drunkard to do it. If you're too precise it will just snap. You gotta be loose with it! Just flop them onto the spikes and the fibers will come apart by themselves!
Imagine a drunkard crossing threads onto spikes and pulling the tiny fibers free. You don't think you could do that. Maybe if you got drunk too...
Reading Mnemonic
You stare at the fibers easily coming apart when you realize that this drunkard seems to have a few extra legs... and hair and a tail? This isn't just a drunk guy, it's a centaur (せん). Maybe separating fibers is really a centaur trick, and that's why normal people can't do it...
Watch the centaur cross the fibers and separate them with his spikes. How strange.
